results.title: Victoria's welcome to press delegates
results.brief_description: Viscount Burnham is welcomed by S.S. Argyle, M.L.A. Chief Secretary of Victoria. Items of interest are pointed out, indicating Victoria’s development as a state including footage of Sir John Monash, development of the Hume Weir, Yallourn Open Cut mine, the Dandenong Ranges/Ferntree Gully, Yarra Glen, Camperdown, Rochester, the “Better Farming Train”, Bendigo, Geelong and Geelong Grammar, and Ballarat. Source: National Film and Sound Archive.

results.title: Understanding Cancer Pt.3
results.brief_description: This program is the final part of a three part documentary that looks at cancer. The program concentrates on the three main types of treatment that are offered to cancer patients - surgery, chemotherapy, and radiotherapy. Specialists in these fields discuss the treatments and when it is appropriate to use them.

results.title: Understanding Cancer Pt.2
results.brief_description: This program is the second part of a three part documentary that looks at cancer. Presented by Professor Richard Fox of the Ludwig Institute of Cancer Research, this program focuses on the disease from the patient’s point of view. The patients who appear in this documentary discuss their experiences with treatment and talk about their physical and emotional reactions.

results.title: Understanding Cancer Pt.1
results.brief_description: This program is the first of a three part documentary that looks at cancer. Presented by Professor Richard Fox, from the Ludwig Institute for Cancer Research, this program examines issues such as, what is cancer? and what causes cancer? Cancer specialists discuss these issues and comment on the influences of factors such as diet, environment and genetics.

results.title: The Devil's toy
results.creator_credit: Claude Jutra, Marcel Martin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The skateboard gave the youngsters, who mastered its technique, a thrilling sensation of speed unexcelled by any other pavement sport. Filmed in 1966 on Montreal streets before the elongated rollerskate was banned, this film captures the exuberance of boys and girls having the time of their lives in free-wheeling downhill locomotion. Music by Pierre Brault. Sung by Genevieve Bujold.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Claude Jutra, Marcel Martin and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: This is working
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Elisabeth Knight, Film Australia and National Aboriginal Employment Development Committee
results.brief_description: Aboriginal people suffer an unemployment rate six times higher than the white community. Shows Aboriginal people in New South Wales who are working on four different job creation projects. Features, amongst others, Bill Powell, Aboriginal Liaison Officer TAFE, Rose Kirby, Murrin Bridge Handcraft Industries, Des Simon, apprentice carpenter, Purfleet and Dallas Carberry, park management trainee, Orient Point.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Keith Gow, Elisabeth Knight, Film Australia and National Aboriginal Employment Development Committee
